primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: Jesus is authorized as God's agent to perform God's story on earth, surviving the wilderness to inaugurate the Kingdom.

tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus simply plunged into the Jordan River
to do God’s work with God’s authority on earth
the true story of the world
The voice of God identifying Jesus
God’s own agent on the earth
for the sake of the gospel
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: Does hearer identify with Subject or Receiver?

tekstueel_bewijs: forces of heaven to make sure the wild beast-occupied wilderness is... a safe place

tegenstander.identificatie: Wild Beasts / The Wilderness / The Empire of Evil
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is identified as a systemic 'empire of evil' and 'greed system' that eventually executes the Subject.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The baptized believer replicates Jesus' journey: receiving identity, entering the wilderness, and performing the vocation.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The sermon uses a 'parallelism' structure where the hearer's life is mapped 1:1 onto Jesus' life (Exemplarism).

voorbeelden_god_subject: the Spirit said, You are my Son
God has dispatched the forces of heaven
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we might think for a while
we take the plunge yet again
we stumble between our vocation and our resistance

voorbeelden: resolved to live a different kind of life
consider how that vocation may make a difference
imagine the wonder of our baptism

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses heavily on recruiting the will (Vouloir) and the imagination (Savoir) of the hearer to embrace a difficult vocation.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S1 (Baptism) to S2 (Wilderness) to ~S2 (Angels) back to S1 (Vocation in Jerusalem).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through 'Angelic help' and 'Resolve', allowing the Subject to face S2.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; the world is described as actively resisting and 'wanting to talk us out of our baptisms'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While it uses high theocentric language regarding Jesus' identity, the application to the hearer is heavily moralistic/exemplarist, focusing on the hearer's 'plunge' and 'resolve'.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: Now in Lent we take the plunge yet again.
The vocation of baptism calls us to do God’s work in the world.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God celebrates us in our new identity.
surprising, sustaining gifts of God are given to us.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Jesus' baptism and wilderness experience are treated as a template for the believer's Lenten journey.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Christ's wilderness victory as the ground of our peace, rather than our imitation of his 'plunge'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to 'perform' the vocation amidst 'wild beasts'.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Soteriology is fused with Ethics; the 'plunge' is something we do.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The parallel between Jesus and the Church is narratively tight but theologically risky.
spanning_punten: Jesus' baptism was 'for forgiveness', but the hearer's baptism is framed primarily as 'vocation'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: to do in our context what Jesus did in his context

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit 'propels' and 'approves' but the Subject must 'walk'.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is a 'greed system' and 'empire of evil'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully establishes God as the Sender of identity but quickly shifts the Subject role to the hearer, making the 'plunge' a human work.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the subject of 'taking the plunge'.
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: God as the one who plunges us into Christ.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'We take the plunge', use 'In Lent, the Spirit plunges us deeper into the reality of Christ's victory'.

identificatie_herstel.problematische_identificatie: Hearer as the hero in the wilderness.
identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize the passivity of the 'Beloved' before the activity of the 'Agent'.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on how the Spirit provides the 'Pouvoir' (ability) when we are 'disabled'.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Well-developed; the 'greed system' is a strong opponent.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already has a strong sense of the 'Heavy Opponent'.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Ground the 'vocation' in the finished work of Christ's wilderness victory.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: The sermon is rhetorically powerful and socially conscious, but it risks turning the Gospel into a new 'mandate' for the hearer to fulfill.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'plunge' metaphor is brilliant; actantially, it places the burden of action on the hearer.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis of Mark 1 is accurate regarding 'vocation', but the semiotic shift to 'our baptism' introduces exemplarism not necessarily in the text.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that 'God' is the Sender but 'Man' is the Subject of the active verbs of the Lenten journey.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'High Church Moralism' where grace provides the identity, but the hearer provides the performance.
